ygData.subject: Re: Listen, here. Listen well.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, and here is what information I gained from that attempt. I did not find Salvador (thats not his name, but I know it s something like that) online, but
ygData.messageBody:
>Joshua Bednarz,
>
>Weren't you the one who said you were going to try to "infiltrate" the
>guild
>of Salvador?
>
>Xalastile

Yes, and here is what information I gained from that attempt. I did not find
Salvador (thats not his name, but I know it's something like that) online,
but I did a who 40-50 gnome all serch to see if any of them were his
friends. It turns out, the first guy I talked to was his friend, or used to
be rather (they seem to have had a fight) He said Salvador hadn't been on
for a long time, but he had been acting strange before he left. He said that
Salvador would be the kind of person that would do something like find a
secret that he could make pofit off of, then keep it to himself, but his
friend said he had no knowledge that Salvador had ever been making
collapsible fishing poles, or spy glasses. He also said it was very unlikely
that he could have found out the recipe also, since Salvador never was
interested in tinkering. That was the information I was able to gather from
that expedition.

>Joshua Bednarz,
>
>Weren't you the one who said you were going to try to "infiltrate" the
>guild
>of Salvador?
>
>Xalastile
